item.title: Annisa add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "I like to see people reunited, I like to see people run to each other, I like the kissing and the crying, I like the impatience, the stories that the mouth can't tell fast enough, the ears that aren't big enough, the eyes that can't take in all of the change, I like the hugging, the bringing together, the end of missing someone." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Perhaps, after all, romance did not come into one’s life with pomp and blare, like a gay knight riding down; perhaps it crept to one’s side like an old friend through quiet ways; perhaps it revealed itself in seeming prose, until some sudden shaft of illumination flung athwart its pages betrayed the rhythm and the music, perhaps . . . perhaps . . . love unfolded naturally out of a beautiful friendship, as a golden-hearted rose slipping from its green sheath." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If writers wrote as carelessly as some people talk, then adhasdh asdglaseuyt[bn[ pasdlgkhasdfasdf." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Does it break my heart, of course, every moment of every day, into more pieces than my heart was made of, I never thought of myself as quiet, much less silent, I never thought about things at all, everything changed, the distance that wedged itself between me and my happiness wasn't the world, it wasn't the bombs and burning buildings, it was me, my thinking, the cancer of never letting go, is ignorance bliss, I don't know, but it's so painful to think, and tell me, what did thinking ever do for me, to what great place did thinking ever bring me? I think and think and think, I've thought myself out of happiness one million times, but never once into it." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "People die of broken hearts. They have heart attacks. And it's the heart that hurts most when things go wrong and fall apart." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Kate DiCamillo
item.description: "There is nothing sweeter in this sad world than the sound of someone you love calling your name." -- Kate DiCamillo

item.title: Annisa add a quote by John von Neumann
item.description: "If people do not believe that mathematics is simple, it is only because they do not realize how complicated life is." -- John von Neumann

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Paul Erdos
item.description: "I'll tell you once, and I'll tell you again. There's always a prime between n and 2n." -- Paul Erdos

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Lois Lowry
item.description: "The worst part of holding the memories is not the pain. It's the loneliness of it. Memories need to be shared." -- Lois Lowry

item.title: Annisa add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I was trying to feel some kind of good-bye. I mean I’ve left schools and places I didn’t even know I was leaving them. I hate that. I don’t care if it’s a sad good-bye or a bad good-bye, but when I leave a place I like to know I’m leaving it. If you don’t you feel even worse." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There are so many fragile things, after all. People break so easily, and so do dreams and hearts." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Actual happiness always looks pretty squalid in comparison with the overcompensations for misery. And, of course, stability isn't nearly so spectacular as instability. And being contented has none of the glamour of a good fight against misfortune, none of the picturesqueness of a struggle with temptation, or a fatal overthrow by passion or doubt. Happiness is never grand." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't ask for guarantees. And don't look to be saved in any one thing, person, machine, or library. Do your own bit of saving, and if you drown, at least die knowing you were heading for shore." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Annisa add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Ray Bradbury
Annisa add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Science can teach us, and I think our hearts can teach us, no longer to look around for imaginary supporters, no longer to invent allies in the sky, but rather to look to our own efforts here below to make the world a fit place to live." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "We inhabit a universe where atoms are made in the centers of stars; where each second a thousand suns are born; where life is sparked by sunlight and lightning in the airs and waters of youthful planets; where the raw material for biological evolution is sometimes made by the explosion of a star halfway across the Milky Way; where a thing as beautiful as a galaxy is formed a hundred billion times - a Cosmos of quasars and quarks, snowflakes and fireflies, where there may be black holes and other universe and extraterrestrial civilizations whose radio messages are at this moment reaching the Earth. How pallid by comparison are the pretensions of superstition and pseudoscience; how important it is for us to pursue and understand science, that characteristically human endeavor. " -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "There's always a moment when you start to fall out of love, whether it's with a person or an idea or a cause, even if it's one you only narrate to yourself years after the event: a tiny thing, a wrong word, a false note, which means that things can never be quite the same again." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Annisa add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "It is sometimes said that scientists are unromantic, that their passion to figure out robs the world of beauty and mystery. But is it not stirring to understand how the world actually works — that white light is made of colors, that color is the way we perceive the wavelengths of light, that transparent air reflects light, that in so doing it discriminates among the waves, and that the sky is blue for the same reason that the sunset is red? It does no harm to the romance of the sunset to know a little bit about it." -- Carl Sagan
